data.title: Digital Root Sequence
data.statement:
The digital root of a number is the recursive sum of its digits until only one digit remains. For example, the digital root of 65536 is 7 because 6+5+5+3+6=25, then 2+5=7.

Consider the following sequence:

Start with a given integer N

Each next term is the digital root of the previous term multiplied by 2

Continue until the sequence becomes periodic (when a term repeats)

Your task is to find the length of the sequence before it starts repeating (the number of unique terms before the first repetition).

Example with N=5:

Term 1: 5

Term 2: digital root of 5×2 = digital root of 10 = 1

Term 3: digital root of 1×2 = digital root of 2 = 2

Term 4: digital root of 2×2 = digital root of 4 = 4

Term 5: digital root of 4×2 = digital root of 8 = 8

Term 6: digital root of 8×2 = digital root of 16 = 7

Term 7: digital root of 7×2 = digital root of 14 = 5 (repeats term 1)

The sequence is: 5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 7, then back to 5. So the length before repetition is 6.
data.inputDescription: A single integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 10^9), the starting number.
data.outputDescription:
A single integer: the length of the sequence before it starts repeating.
